author: Alyssa Nyberg Restoration Ecologist at Kankakee Sands
title: Indiana Nature Notes - That's Golden!
text:
A golden eagle (Aquila chysaetos) was recently spotted soaring over the Kankakee Sands prairie, to which we say, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs Golden!‚Äù
It‚Äôs awesome news because it reaffirms everything that we want Kankakee Sands to be ‚Äì a home for those species who spend their whole lives here on the prairies and savannas, as well as a seasonal home for those species ‚Äî like the golden eagle ‚Äî who might overwinter in Indiana rather than in the frozen tundra to the north.
Over the last 10-20 years, golden eagles have been seen on occasion in Newton County. It‚Äôs a very memorable experience to see a large golden eagle ‚Äî it stands 2.5 feet tall and has a wing span of nearly 6.5 feet!
Though golden eagles are a large bird, they are notorious for begin fast and agile in flight. They have been clocked at nearly 200 miles per hour!
For such a large, fast, nimble creature, it has a sweet call that sounds to me like I imagine a seagull in love might sound. https://www.allaboutbirds.org/guide/Golden_Eagle/sounds
While exciting, it can also be a little confusing. Due to their size, they are often confused from afar with bald eagles and turkey vultures. And so identifying the golden eagle requires an eagle eye for detail.
The golden eagle is named for the golden feathers at the nape of its neck which look radiant in the correct light. However, on overcast days, those same identifying feathers can look tawny brown and rather lackluster.
So, look instead for its large, hooked beak. This beak is used for eating small mammals such as rabbits and ground squirrels.
And don‚Äôt let their plumage fool you. Like many birds, golden eagles have plumage variations depending on age. Juvenile golden eagles will have white wing patches and a white tail band when viewed from below. Older golden eagles lack the white feathers and have darker plumage covering their entire body.
That‚Äôs the amazing thing about nature: we can experience that feeling of awe and admiration, and also be challenged to learn more about everything we‚Äôre seeing and hearing. Asking questions is how we learn!
Golden eagles can be found all across the northern hemisphere of the globe in areas of large open grassland habitat. Here in North American, golden eagles inhabit Alaska, Canada, northern Mexico and much of the United States, including right here at Kankakee Sands in Newton County, Indiana!
As winter draws to a close, stop by Kankakee Sands to try to spot a golden eagle before they return to their summer breeding grounds in Canada and Alaska. If you catch sight of one, consider yourself extremely fortunate and enjoy the priceless view!
For more information on this gorgeous, iconic, national bird of Albania, Austria, Germany, Kazakhstan, and Mexico and winter-time visitor to Kankakee Sands, check out the US Fish and Wildlife Service webpage on Golden Eagles https://www.fws.gov/species/golden-eagle-aquila-chrysaetos.
The Nature Conservancy‚Äôs Kankakee Sands is an 8,400-acre prairie and savanna habitat in Northwest Indiana, open every day of the year for public enjoyment. It‚Äôs an exciting year for Kankakee Sands, as we are making major improvements to popular areas within the preserve.
If you plan to visit, please check our Facebook page to see if any of the areas you want to see will be impacted by the construction.
For more information about Kankakee Sands, visit www.nature.org/KankakeeSands or call the office at 219-285-2184.

author: Tennis World USA
title: Jasmine Paolini gets real on upcoming opponent Elina Svitolina
text:
Jasmine Paolini has reached the 3rd round of the Australian Open 2025, after beating Renata Zarazu in straight sets, with a score of 6-2 6-3.
Last season, the Italian won for the first time in her career two consecutive matches in a Major right in Melbourne. This year, after two Slam finals in singles and an Olympic gold medal in doubles, she has reached a new awareness in her tennis and in her confidence.
Jasmine's path will now cross with that of Elina Svitolina, in the highly anticipated match for the access to the 4th round and the second week of the Happy Slam.
After qualifying for the 3rd round where she will challenge the Ukrainian, Jasmine analyzed in the post match: "I was a bit nervous and tense at the beginning of the match, I started with a double fault and immediately took a break. Then little by little I loosened up and found my game.
But it wasn't a very easy match because with her the ball always comes back and one of the goals was not to get caught up in the rush. Playing the evening session on a court like that is a beautiful feeling; when I wasn't seeded I always hoped not to play on those courts because it meant immediately facing a very high seed.
I always said: it would be nice to play there because of myself and not because of my opponent. Now I try to enjoy it, I consider it a privilege. I trained with Svitolina a couple of times but I've never played against her and I don't know what to expect. She has a lot of experience at a high level, I know it will be a difficult match."
Paolini d. Zarazua 6-2 6-3 at Australian Open
‚Äî The Tennis Letter (@TheTennisLetter)
Another win for Jasmine‚Ä¶ she does that a lot these days.
Last year, she reached her 1st Slam R3 here.
1 year later, she does it again.
‚úÖ4-1 in 2025
She‚Äôs turned herself into one heck of a tennis player.

author: @infobae
title: El fin de ‚ÄúEl club del cheque‚Äù, la empresa fantasma de Nordelta que lavaba dinero y cay√≥ por un control vehicular - Infobae
text:
El dinero secuestrado en los allanamientos A partir de una investigaci√≥n iniciada hace casi un a√±o y coordinada por el Ministerio de Seguridad, la Polic√≠a Federal Argentina logr√≥ desmantelar y detener en las √∫ltimas horas a una banda delictiva que se dedicaba al lavado de dinero , la cual se desempe√±aba principalmente en la zona de Nordelta, al norte del Gran Buenos Aires; aunque tambi√©n hac√≠a movimientos en otros lugares del territorio bonaerense.
La organizaci√≥n -que operaba en el mercado financiero de manera marginal- era conocida como ‚ÄúEl club del cheque‚Äù . Se trata del nombre que hab√≠an elegido sus integrantes para la empresa fantasma y sin capacidad econ√≥mica, montada para llevar a cabo distintas actividades financieras sin autorizaci√≥n legal .
La supuesta compa√±√≠a contaba con varias sucursales ubicadas en diferentes localidades. Sin embargo, todos estos negocios solo exist√≠an para darle apariencia legal a las ganancias que obten√≠an los involucrados de movimientos de dinero no autorizados.
Su desarticulaci√≥n ocurri√≥ en el marco de una serie de 10 allanamientos realizados por la PFA en domicilios de Nordelta, partido de Tigre; las localidades bonaerenses de Jun√≠n y 9 de Julio; y en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires.
La financiera operaba en la zona de Nordelta En estos operativos, se concret√≥ la detenci√≥n de cinco sospechosos y se secuestraron grandes cantidades de dinero.
Entre los montos especificados por las autoridades, se confiscaron m√°s d e 62 millones de pesos, 50 mil d√≥lares y 10 mil euros. Tambi√©n se llevaron una m√°quina contadora de billetes y documentaci√≥n de inter√©s.
Las viviendas en las que se encontraron las pruebas contra esta banda fueron localizadas luego de casi un a√±o de investigaci√≥n. Todo se descubri√≥ a mediados de 2023 y a partir de un control de tr√°nsito , en el que se encontraron grandes cantidades de dinero en uno de los autos detenidos en el operativo.
El operativo estuvo a cargo de la PFA Seg√∫n especificaron fuentes policiales, en el mencionado chequeo vehicular se detuvo la marcha de un rodado y se identific√≥ al conductor. Si bien se trataba de una verificaci√≥n de rutina, los polic√≠as que participaban de la revisi√≥n detectaron que el automovilista contaba con dos bolsos colmados de plata en su interior.
En uno de esos bolsos hab√≠a dos millones de pesos en efectivo, mientras que el otro 15.000 mil d√≥lares . Y, aunque se le consult√≥ de d√≥nde proven√≠a ese dinero, en esa oportunidad el sujeto no pudo justificar su tenencia y origen.
A partir de ese momento, el Juzgado dispuso la intervenci√≥n de la divisi√≥n Lavado de Activos de PFA, la cual tom√≥ el caso y comenz√≥ un largo proceso de averiguaci√≥n para descubrir qu√© hab√≠a detr√°s.
En este contexto, los polic√≠as confeccionaron un amplio informe patrimonial del imputado, en el que hallaron que el dinero estaba vinculado con una importante financiera con asiento principal en la zona de Nordelta.
Se realizaron 10 allanamientos en el marco de la investigaci√≥n En consecuencia, se procedi√≥ a realizar diversas tareas de campo para identificar a la empresa en cuesti√≥n y a los responsables. En estos trabajos fue que se conoci√≥ que la compa√±√≠a llevaba el nombre de ‚ÄúEl club del cheque‚Äù. De acuerdo a la investigaci√≥n, funcionaba como una ‚Äúcueva‚Äù .
En este sentido, constataron que, con objetivo de para expandir su actividad y ocultar su identidad, los implicados tambi√©n hab√≠an decidido crear una ‚Äúsociedad fantasma‚Äù , que operaba a modo de pantalla y era utilizada para abrir distintos locales de la misma franquicia, a trav√©s de los cuales iban re invirtiendo las ganancias obtenidas de los negocios que ya funcionaban.
En el caso intervino el Juzgado Federal de primera instancia de Mercedes, a cargo de Elpidio Portocarrero Tezanos Pinto , Secretaria Penal N¬∞ 2 de Guillermo Schnaider , desde donde se avalaron los allanamientos y las detenciones.
